IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING HOUSING, SUPERVISION, TRAINING AND THERAPEUTIC, MEDICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN THE STATE OF ALABAMA. THE ORGANIZATION WAS INCORPORATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES VARIOUS HOUSING, SUPERVISION, TRAINING, THERAPY, MEDICAL SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN THE STATE OF ALABAMA.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES RESIDENTIAL AND BASIC TRAINING SKILLS TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SUPERVISION, TRAINING AND THERAPEUTIC, MEDICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A TRUSTEE FOR CLIENT FUNDS WHICH ARE EXPENDED ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENTS FOR PERSONAL ITEMS. THE AMOUNT OF CLIENT FUNDS HELD AND THE OFFSETTING LIABILITY AT JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, AMOUNTED TO APPROXIMATELY $80,900 AND $68,900, RESPECTIVELY. THESE AMOUNTS HAVE NOT BEEN REFLECTED IN FORM 990, PART X.

RESOURCES FOR INDEPENDENCE, INC.'S PERSONNEL ARE EMPLOYED BY SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC., A RELATED 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION. THAT ORGANIZATION USES THE FOLLOWING TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION FOR RESOURCES FOR INDEPENDENCE, INC.'S CEO: FORM 990 OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, COMPENSATION SURVEY OR STUDY, AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION IS PHINEAS CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S SOLE MEMBER, PHINEAS CORPORATION, HAS THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED. A COPY OF THE RETURN, AS ULTIMATELY FILED, IS PROVIDED TO EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL EMPLOYEES, EXECUTIVES, TRUSTEES AND BOARD MEMBERS. THE PRESIDENT & CEO MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MUST FULLY DISCLOSE TO THE BOARD CHAIR ANY CONTRACT, BUSINESS ARRANGEMENT, OR DIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST IN A BUSINESS THAT CONTRACTS OR TRANSACTS BUSINESS WITH THE ORGANIZATION. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, EMPLOYEES AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS MUST MAKE SUCH DISCLOSURES TO THE PRESIDENT & CEO. THE BOARD CHAIR (IN MATTERS INVOLVING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS), OR THE PRESIDENT & CEO (IN MATTERS INVOLVING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, EMPLOYEES, AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS), MAY DECIDE WHETHER TO ALLOW CONTINUING INVOLVEMENT IN THE DISCUSSION AND DECISION PROCESS, AND TO WHAT DEGREE (I.E. DISCUSSION ONLY AND THE MEMBER MUST ABSTAIN FROM VOTING), BEFORE PROCEEDING. THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OR NOTES OF THE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.
NET ASSETS TRANSFERRED FROM RELATED PARTIES 238,927.

OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM AND OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE WAS NO CHANGE IN THIS PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

NET ASSET TRANSFERS FROM (TO) RELATED PARTIES: THE SUNRISE GROUP'S CASH MANAGEMENT POLICIES REQUIRE ALL CASH RECEIPTS TO BE TRANSFERRED TO THE SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC. GENERAL OPERATING ACCOUNT. CASH TRANSFERS BACK TO THE ORGANIZATION ARE ONLY MADE TO COVER ITS REQUIRED CASH FLOW NEEDS, CREATING A DUE (TO) FROM SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC. SINCE THERE IS NO INTENTION TO REPAY THESE RELATED-PARTY BALANCES, ANY EXCESS CASH TRANSFERS ARE CONSIDERED A PERMANENT TRANSFER OF NET ASSETS AT YEAR END. DURING THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE ORGANIZATION TRANSFERRED NET ASSETS (TO) FROM RELATED PARTIES AMOUNTING TO $238,927 AND $(146,734), RESPECTIVELY.
